definitions: To convey (water, gas, etc.) through pipes.
To play (music) on a pipe instrument.
To utter in a high-pitched voice.
To connect (two processes or commands) so that the output of one becomes the input of the other.
examples: The plumber pipes water to the new faucet.
The musician pipes a lively tune.
She pipes up with an answer.
The shell pipes the output of 'ls' to 'grep'.
